Package com.shouldis.bitset

Interface WordFunction

public interface WordFunction
Functional interface used in conjunction with BitSet.applyFunction(int, WordFunction). apply(long) should represent a function used to manipulate the bits within the words of a BitSet. Useful for performing more complex operations outside the suite of typical bitwise operations.
Author:
Aaron Shouldis

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static WordFunction NOT
    WordFunction used to invert the bits within the argument word.
    static WordFunction REVERSE
    WordFunction used to reverse the order of bits within the argument word.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    long apply​(long word)
    Function used to perform operations on the words within a BitSet.
    static WordFunction combine​(WordFunction first, WordFunction second)
    Creates WordFunctions that are combinations of two other WordFunctions.
    static WordFunction hangingReverse​(BitSet set)
    WordFunction used to reverse the order of bits within the argument word.
    static WordFunction hangingRotateLeft​(BitSet set, int distance)
    WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the left.
    static WordFunction hangingRotateRight​(BitSet set, int distance)
    WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the right.
    static WordFunction hangingShiftLeft​(BitSet set, int distance)
    WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the left.

    WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the right.

  • Field Details

    • NOT

      static final WordFunction NOT
      WordFunction used to invert the bits within the argument word.

    • REVERSE

      static final WordFunction REVERSE
      WordFunction used to reverse the order of bits within the argument word.

  • Method Details

    • apply

      long apply​(long word)
      Function used to perform operations on the words within a BitSet.
      Parameters:
      word - the original word to manipulate.
      Returns:
      the manipulated word.

    • hangingReverse

      static WordFunction hangingReverse​(BitSet set)
      WordFunction used to reverse the order of bits within the argument word. Performs the operations of REVERSE, but only appropriate for the last word of the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to generate the reverse function for.
      Returns:
      the function used to reverse the final word in set.

    • shiftRight

      static WordFunction shiftRight​(int distance)
      WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the right.
      Parameters:
      distance - how far to shift the bits to the right.
      Returns:
      a function representing a shift by distance bits.

    • hangingShiftRight

      static WordFunction hangingShiftRight​(BitSet set, int distance)
      WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the right. Performs the operations of shiftRight(int), but only appropriate for the last word of the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to generate the right shift function for.
      distance - how far to shift the bits to the right.
      Returns:
      the function used to shift the final word in set.

    • shiftLeft

      static WordFunction shiftLeft​(int distance)
      WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the left.
      Parameters:
      distance - how far to shift the bits to the left.
      Returns:
      a function representing a shift by distance bits.

    • hangingShiftLeft

      static WordFunction hangingShiftLeft​(BitSet set, int distance)
      WordFunction used to shift the bits within the argument word to the left. Performs the operations of shiftLeft(int), but only appropriate for the last word of the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to generate the left shift function for.
      distance - how far to shift the bits to the left.
      Returns:
      the function used to shift the final word in set.

    • rotateRight

      static WordFunction rotateRight​(int distance)
      WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the right.
      Parameters:
      distance - how far to rotate the bits to the right.
      Returns:
      a function representing a shift by distance bits.

    • hangingRotateRight

      static WordFunction hangingRotateRight​(BitSet set, int distance)
      WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the right. Performs the operations of rotateRight(int), but only appropriate for the last word of the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to generate the right rotate function for.
      distance - how far to rotate the bits to the right.
      Returns:
      the function used to shift the final word in set.

    • rotateLeft

      static WordFunction rotateLeft​(int distance)
      WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the left.
      Parameters:
      distance - how far to rotate the bits to the left.
      Returns:
      a function representing a shift by distance bits.

    • hangingRotateLeft

      static WordFunction hangingRotateLeft​(BitSet set, int distance)
      WordFunction used to rotate the bits within the argument word to the left. Performs the operations of rotateLeft(int), but only appropriate for the last word of the specified BitSet set.
      Parameters:
      set - the BitSet to generate the left rotate function for.
      distance - how far to rotate the bits to the left.
      Returns:
      the function used to shift the final word in set.

    • combine

      static WordFunction combine​(WordFunction first, WordFunction second)
      Creates WordFunctions that are combinations of two other WordFunctions.
      Parameters:
      first - the first WordFunction to be applied to the word argument.
      second - the second WordFunction to be applied to the result of first.
      Returns:
      a WordFunction which applies both first and second.
